instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924-A. a Quarter of the display is white and No External Video
threads.message:
820-4924-A. a Quarter of the display is white and No External Video(Tested with internal display connected and disconnected). Thunderbolt ports do nothing. HDMI port Causes the screen to flash on and off as if it is connecting and disconnecting from a display.

No Signs of Liquid Damage on board. Board was very dusty and looks like it had some sand on it. A tiny bit of what looks like a liquid residue on the top thunderbolt port. 

Same issues with good display. 

Apple Hardware test passes no issues found. 

I'm lost on where to start with this. Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924-A. a Quarter of the display is white and No External Video
threads.message: Mark as Resolved. It was a Bad display. :confused:
